intro: Montanoa affinis, commonly known as the Mexican mountain mallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Montanoa affinis is often found in moist, rocky habitats at higher elevations.
